nodes.tooltip: Occupation: Unknown.
Occupation: Unknown.

Recruits Chinese clients for Trump tourism. Claims to be both a prince and an ambassador to the United Nations, a claim unsupported by U.N. documentation. Sells trips to promote Chinese President Xi Jinping's business diplomacy initiative.
The 45th president of the United States, elected in November 2016.
CEO of Silver Aristocrats, an arm of an online investment bank marketed to wealthy Chinese clients.
Occupation: Unknown.

Chinese businessman, according to Cliff Li. "An important guest invited by the Womens Charity Foundation to Safari Night," according to the foundation's WeChat. Xiong bid for two $20,000 paintings on the spot to support the charity sale.
President of Guangdong Huizhou Fuji Real Estate Development Co., Ltd., according to Dr. Charles Lee's website. Awarded U.S.-China Friendship Ambassador award by Dr. Charles Lee.
Chinese-born tech executive, founder of 5miles and CyberMiles, jersey sponsor of the Dallas Mavericks.

Dec. 2, 2017: Fundraiser for Trump's 2020 re-election campaign in New York and attended by President Donald Trump, adviser Kellyanne Conway and other top members of the GOP. Entry fee: $1,000 - $50,000

Jan. 26, 2018: Fundraiser for a little-known children's charity hosted by Elizabeth Trump Grau, the president's sister. This event would turn Mar-a-Lago into the No. 1 location for Trump tourism. Entry fee: $1,000 - $10,000
Feb. 25, 2018: Last minute pro-Israel event held at Mar-a-Lago after larger charities pulled out post-Charlottesville, attended by future Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis. Entry fee: $750 - $75,000
March 3, 2018: Fundraiser for President Trump's 2020 re-election campaign held at Mar-a-Lago, attended by Donald Trump and other top members of the GOP. Entry fee: $2,700- $50,000
Dec. 31, 2018: Invite-only New Year's Eve party held at Mar-a-Lago and attended by Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump. Entry Fee: $1,000
Political action committee exclusively benefiting President Trump's 2020 re-election campaign.
Group of businesses belonging to President Trump and currently managed by his two adult sons.

President of the Florida Chapter of the Council for the Promotion of Peaceful Unification â€” a group "directly subordinate" to the Communist Party of China, according to a 2018 U.S. government report. Co-founder with Cindy Yang of Women's Charity Foundation Inc.

Miami real estate investor specializing in developments qualified for EB-5 investor visas. He is the face of a Florida company that is 83% owned by the Chinese government, according to business ownership records.
Chinese-born bitcoin miner who runs his business from Australia. Known online as "the Martian."
Chairman of China Shuanghe Education Group, according to Dr. Charles' Lee's invite. KidsRKids China Franchisee, according to a spokesperson for KidsRKids China.
Cindy Yang's husband, manager of Tokyo Day Spas and a co-founder of the company GY US Investments, which advertises access to President Trump.
Chinese actress and model, according to The New York Times.
Chairman of China Dragon Automotive Investment, according to Cindy Yang's WeChat.
General manager of China Dragon Automotive Investment, according to Cindy Yang's WeChat and business website.
New York socialite and associate of Cindy Yang; she once told a magazine there was zero distance between her and the Trumps.
Chinese financier accused of securities fraud in China, currently living in New York.
Occupation: Unknown.
Occupation: Unknown.
Occupation: Unknown.
Occupation: Unknown.
Co-chair of the Houston Independent Film Festival and famous painter, according to an Asian GOP blog post.
Occupation: Unknown.
Occupation: Unknown.

Also known as Monica Shang. Head of the Chinese Performing Arts Group and former chairwoman of the Association of Science and Technology Associations, a group associated with the Chinese Communist Party.

March 30, 2019: Canceled Mar-a-Lago fundraiser for Young Adventurers Children's Charity, advertised by Cindy Yang as a chance for Chinese elites to mingle with members of the Trump family and "do propaganda." Entry fee: unknown.
Chinese woman arrested attempting to enter Mar-a-Lago for Cindy Yang's event carrying various electronics, including a jump drive containing malware.
Received "U.S. China Friendship Ambassador" award from Dr. Charles Lee's group. Occupation: Unknown.
Awarded U.S.-China Friendship Ambassador award by Dr. Charles Lee. Occupation: Unknown.
